description.text:
Brevo is the leading and fast-growing Customer Relationship Management (CRM) suite designed to enable millions of organizations to connect with people using technology for their success. Our platform gives businesses a unified view of the entire customer journey, empowering them to grow with intuitive marketing and sales tools, including Marketing Automation, Email, Push, SMS, WhatsApp, Chat, and much more. As a proud B Corp certified company, we are committed not only to performance but also to purpose‚Äîmeeting high standards of social and environmental impact.

Today, more than 500,000 businesses across 180 countries, including Louis Vuitton, Carrefour, eBay, and Michelin, trust Brevo‚Äôs reliable technology and 75+ integrations to deliver unparalleled customer experiences, reduce costs, and drive sales. Brevo reached ‚Ç¨179M ARR in 2024 (35% growth year on year) and has close to 1,000 employees globally.

A portfolio that showcases strong conceptual thinking, sharp design execution, and a range of work across marketing and brand channels is mandatory.
We‚Äôre looking for a Brand Designer with a strong visual voice and a strategic mind to help bring our brand to life across all touchpoints. You‚Äôll be a key player in shaping and evolving our brand identity while translating business goals into creative ideas that engage and inspire.

In this role, you‚Äôll collaborate within Brand and Creative team with Marketing, Sales and other teams to craft compelling visual assets, from digital campaigns and social content to event branding and sales materials. You‚Äôll balance hands-on design execution with conceptual thinking, ensuring everything we create reflects our brand values and delivers real impact.

As a Brand Designer, you will : 

Lead brand design initiatives across marketing, digital, and print platforms, ensuring consistency and excellence in every assetTranslate marketing strategies into engaging visual concepts and campaignsCreate a wide range of materials, including social media graphics, digital ads, sales collateral, event visuals, Ebooks, motion briefs/story boards, and morePartner closely with content, marketing, sales teams to align design with messaging and business goalsEvolve and maintain the brand identity system, expanding guidelines as neededCollaborate with external vendors (e.g. agencies, freelancers, printers‚Ä¶) when neededStay current with design trends, technologies, and marketing best practices



What will contribute to your success: 

6+ years of experience in brand, marketing, or visual design roles, preferably within a fast-paced environment : Start-up, Scale-up, B2B, SaaS environment or agencies..Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, you‚Äôre able to clearly articulate your ideas, explain the reasoning behind your design choices, and advocate for them with confidence and clarityExpertise in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) and FigmaSolid understanding of typography, layout, color theory, and visual hierarchyExperience creating assets for both digital and print formatsFluency in English (you're comfortable working in an international team)Ability to balance multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines without sacrificing quality



Nice to have!

A background in art direction or campaign developmentFamiliarity with performance marketing and data-informed design approachesExperience with motion/animation, video editing tools (e.g aftereffects, Premiere)Good understanding of UX/UI design principles



What we offer:

Meal vouchers - Swile (12,5 ‚Ç¨ per day)Excellent private health care, of which 70% is covered by the companyRTT50% Reimbursement of Navigo or bicycle mileage reimbursementInter-office tripsWork's council benefits (Leeto)Social, green and LGBTQIA+ committees to take care of environmental and social mattersSeveral services related to prevention, health and personal and professional well-being on Welii platformVery competitive referral programSecond parent leave: 1 month of fully paid leaveKids leave: additional time off if your children are sick and need youEnglish classes, and over 155000 courses available on UdemyBudget to support your workspace at homeRelocation package for international talentsA brand new office in a central location with free fruits, drinks & lots of fun activitiesSustainable Mobility Package if you choose to commute to work on a mechanical or electric bike...and more!



Meet us! 

A first call with our HR team (30 min)An interview with our Creative Director (1 hour)A case study and its debrief with our Creative Director & our Senior Brand & Communication Director (1 hour)A final Get2know 



Brevo puts diversity and inclusion at the heart of its values. We examine all applications with treatment based on equal skills and applying the principles of non-discrimination.

Brevo values work-life balance and offers flexible working hours and remote work. This policy is based on a mutual understanding between the Head of, Managers, and Team Members.

description.text:
About us
At Eneba, we‚Äôre building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20 million active users (and growing fast!), providing a level of trust, safety, and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We‚Äôre proud of what we‚Äôve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you.
About the Role
We‚Äôre hiring a PR Growth Partner to lead the development of omni-channel campaigns that drive both brand trust and business outcomes. This is a hybrid PR and growth role ‚Äî not just about generating awareness, but building campaigns that deliver tangible, measurable impact.
You‚Äôll join the Brand Authority team within the Content division and work cross-functionally with Influencers, Partnerships, Product, SEO, and Newsletters to bring compelling, creative narratives to life. From product launches to strategic collaborations, you‚Äôll own the entire campaign lifecycle ‚Äî from ideation and forecasting to rollout and reporting.
About the Team
You‚Äôll report directly to the Content Marketing Manager and collaborate closely with:
Product Leads, Partnerships, Influencers, Newsletters, SEO, and ContentExecutive Team and external consultants on strategic communication projectsInternal writers and designers to shape narratives and briefs
Responsibilities
Own the full lifecycle of PR Growth Campaigns ‚Äî from strategy and narrative development to execution and analysisLaunch creative, trust-focused initiatives across channels like Influencers, Product, Newsletters, SEO, Partnerships, On-site banners, and paid mediaTranslate product or business milestones into compelling stories and angles with measurable bottom-line impactForecast campaign results, define KPIs (e.g. GMV, ROAS, new users), and iterate based on insights from tools like Mixpanel and GABuild and maintain strong media relationships, securing coverage in high-value outlets and platformsDevelop cross-functional campaign roadmaps and briefs that guide internal and external collaborators toward unified executionContribute to Eneba‚Äôs B2B positioning project in collaboration with the executive team and external advisorsHelp build a scalable playbook for trust-based and milestone-driven communication campaigns
Requirement
Must-Have
4+ years of experience in PR, communications, or growth-related marketing roles, ideally within B2C or B2B eCommerce, SaaS, or digital productsHands-on exposure to B2B comms, brand positioning, and internal-external alignmentTrack record of launching creative, multi-channel campaigns that go beyond awareness and deliver measurable business resultsStrong creative thinking and growth hacking mindset ‚Äî you see what others miss and bring bold ideas to lifeExcellent storytelling and narrative-building skills; you know how to package product features or business milestones for multiple audiencesStrategic planning and performance analysis capabilities ‚Äî from roadmap creation to post-launch reportingDeep understanding of how to coordinate XFN marketing (Influencers, SEO, Product, Partnerships, Newsletters, etc.)Comfortable owning high-level initiatives while executing hands-onFamiliar with performance tools like Mixpanel, GA, or similar analytics platforms
Nice to Have
Experience working in gaming, digital marketplaces, or trust-first consumer productsExisting relationships with media and editorial outlets relevant to our target marketsFamiliarity with localization strategy, landing page messaging, and visual storytelling
What‚Äôs in It for You?
Full ownership of high-visibility, cross-functional campaigns with measurable business impactA chance to shape Eneba‚Äôs trust narrative and drive results in both B2C and B2B segmentsDirect involvement in company-wide strategic initiatives ‚Äî including future partnerships and long-term positioningJoin a strong, autonomous marketing team with the resources and freedom to innovatePotential to grow into a leadership role managing newsletters, PR, and campaign contributors
What it‚Äôs like to work at Eneba
Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options programOpportunity to help scale a unique and fast-growing productAccess to performance-based bonuses, referral bonuses, additional paid leave, and learning budgetsPaid volunteering opportunitiesWork where and how you want ‚Äî remote, office-based, or a mix of bothClear feedback and promotion processes supporting fast personal and professional growth

description.text:
At Matter Labs, we believe freedom drives progress and prosperity. We don‚Äôt see ourselves as a company, but as a team aligned around a single mission: to advance personal freedom for all (see ZK Credo).

To achieve this goal, we‚Äôre building zkSync ‚Äî a credibly neutral, fully open source technology stack and network on top of Ethereum, which is owned and governed by its community. We use advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum infinitely without compromising on security or decentralization. With a world-class team, a community of over 1M supporters across Twitter + Discord, and hundreds of millions $ in funding, we have abundant resources to accomplish the mission.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead the product marketing function for Matter Labs by owning end-to-end GTM for ZKsync, covering messaging, competitive insights, sales enablement, and developer education. Produce technical content (white papers, tutorials, videos) and maintain a continuous feedback loop with pilots and the community. Establish and track key metrics to optimize campaigns and expand the ZKsync ecosystem.

What You Will Be Doing

Go-to-Market Strategy: Design and execute comprehensive GTM plans for ZKsync product and feature launches, covering messaging, outreach playbooks, developer education programs, and ecosystem partner coordination.Competitive & Market Insights: Conduct ongoing competitive analyses, market intelligence, and end-user research to inform product positioning, feature prioritization, and technical content strategy.Sales Enablement: Build and maintain up-to-date sales collateral: one-pagers, datasheets, verticalized slide decks (e.g., ‚ÄúBlockchain for Payments,‚Äù ‚ÄúPrivate Transactions for Institutions‚Äù), case studies, and competitor battle cards, so BD and sales teams can articulate value and close deals.Messaging & Positioning: Develop concise, differentiated product messaging tailored to each target segment (developers, enterprises, DeFi users), and ensure consistent technical messaging across all channels.Educational Resources: Lead creation of high-impact developer-focused content such as videos, tutorials, white papers, implementation guides, sample code repositories, and case studies that demonstrate ZKsync‚Äôs value proposition to technical decision-makers.Customer & Community Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize insights from pilots, early adopters, and developer communities, then channel them back into product and marketing priorities.Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key metrics such as developer sign-ups, integrations, MQLs, conversion rates, documentation usage, on-chain activity, churn, and community growth to measure marketing impact and continuously optimize campaigns.

What We Look For In You

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.

description.text:
Description Du Poste

Overview :

Pourquoi rejoindre Reach :

REACH est un acc√©l√©rateur e-commerce sp√©cialis√© dans l‚Äôhyper-croissance. On emm√®ne les marques de 1M‚Ç¨ √† 30M‚Ç¨+ de chiffre d‚Äôaffaires par an avec un mod√®le 100% √† la performance.

Apr√®s 8 ans d‚Äôexp√©rience aux √âtats-Unis et 50 millions d‚Äôeuros d√©pens√©s en publicit√©s, on a d√©velopp√© un playbook unique pour scaler des marques DTC.

Pourquoi on a besoin de toi :

description.text:
Who You‚Äôll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today‚Äôs most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design‚Ä¶).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men‚Äôs/Women‚Äôs Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You‚Äôll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike‚Äôs position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

description.text:
About the Company:eTraining Inc. is a forward-thinking eLearning company dedicated to delivering high-impact workplace safety training and certification programs. With over 14 years of experience, we help mid-to-large companies elevate their safety standards through engaging, effective online education. We operate as a fully remote team and take pride in our open, collaborative, and no-micromanagement culture, where motivated professionals are trusted to take ownership and drive results.
About the Role:We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced  E-learning Head of Growth with a strong background in lead generation and funnel optimization. This role is key to driving qualified leads, increasing brand visibility, and supporting course sales through multi-channel marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will thrive in a remote, entrepreneurial environment and excel at building scalable systems, collaborating cross-functionally, and using data to inform strategy.This is a Full-Time remote position.

We are looking for an E-learning Head of Growth specifically with these requirements:Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.3-5+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally in eLearning, online training, or course-based businesses.Proven success in generating qualified leads and driving course/program sales.Expertise in building and optimizing full marketing funnels (lead magnets, landing pages, email flows).Proficiency with ABM (Account-Based Marketing) and multi-channel outreach.Strong copywriting skills for landing pages, email sequences, and conversion-focused content.Skilled in content strategy - including content calendars, blogs, LinkedIn, webinars, and SME-driven content.Hands-on experience with HubSpot Marketing Hub, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, LinkedIn, and SEO best practices.Familiarity with light website editing, CMS updates, and A/B testing tools.Comfortable analyzing and reporting on key marketing KPIs, campaign performance, and lead quality.A plus: experience using AI tools for content creation, SEO, or funnel optimization.Strong project management skills; able to take initiatives from strategy to execution with minimal oversight.Bonus: industry knowledge in safety training or certification.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Own and manage the marketing funnel, developing lead magnets, landing pages, and email flows to attract and convert high-quality leads.Manage or directly execute paid media buying, and evaluate media buyers to ensure ROI-positive ad spend.Identify and recruit Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to collaborate on authority-building content like blogs, webinars, and podcasts.Research and identify where our ICPs (VPs of Safety at mid-to-large companies) spend time online, and ensure our presence in those spaces.Take ownership of the marketing technology stack (HubSpot, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, etc.), ensuring smooth integration and accurate lead tracking.Lead conversion rate optimization efforts on key landing pages, crafting compelling copy, running A/B tests, and improving funnel performance.Regularly meet with sales and operations stakeholders to align on campaigns, monitor lead quality, and support course launch initiatives.Act as a strategic liaison between sales and operations to ensure marketing aligns with business needs and supports growth.Gather market feedback to inform campaign strategy and help shape new course development.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Be the first dedicated marketer in a well-established, 14-year-old company - with full ownership over the marketing function.Huge potential for growth in title, compensation, and bonus opportunities as the business scales.Work in a collaborative, remote-first culture that values independence, trust, and results.Paid training and 3+ weeks of vacation annually.Covered travel expenses for company-related events or meetings.Flexibility in how you work - as long as you're driving results, you‚Äôll have room to manage your own schedule.The chance to make a real impact and grow alongside a company investing heavily in marketing for the first time.
This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶
You‚Äôre resourceful and solutions-oriented.You love figuring things out, whether it‚Äôs optimizing a funnel, troubleshooting tech issues, or navigating new tools and strategies.
You communicate clearly and collaborate with ease.You‚Äôre confident working cross-functionally with sales and operations, and you keep the team aligned through thoughtful communication.
You‚Äôre driven by results and always looking to improve.You focus on outcomes, not just activity. You seek feedback, analyze performance, and continuously test and iterate to drive better results.
You‚Äôre highly independent and can self-manage.You‚Äôre comfortable owning your role from end to end, managing your time, and consistently delivering without micromanagement.Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

description.text:
Description du poste :

 The International Operational Marketing Executive facilitates the operational & strategic integration between the brand & the markets, ensure flawless communication between the brand & the markets. He promotes the perspectives of growth for the brand in markets.  Scope: Americas Ce que vous aurez √† faire 1. Contribute to Marketing Plan elaboration
- Have in-depth knowledge of brand performance in the markets to provide starting discussion point with the International marketing development team and assess brand needs
- Follow monthly brand net revenues & sell-out performance for markets
- Elaboration of Annual Brand Performance Book 
- Provide feedback & challenge the brand & markets for the next year Marketing Plan
- Help Brand to gather specific market analysis on specific business issues (competition range extensions, retail trends), in order to contribute to resolve marketing plan key decisions (on Promo, GWPs, sets‚Ä¶)
- Responsible for developing Brand and Launch guidelines

 2. Manage the worldwide brand animation: 
- Gather local marketing plans for all markets to have general view of the brand¬¥s activities
- Support Local teams in the elaboration and implementation of their landed marketing plans & launch strategies. And follow-up of the local media plans.
- Propose and coordinate tailor-made/tactical local projects, in a test & learn approach to be then roll-out in other markets
- Contact point for IMR approvals and requests that are under Brand Team responsibility 
- Manage the local requests and assures rest of brand‚Äôs team collaboration / validation when required
- Insure the global coherency for all the elements of a 360¬∞ strategy (Retail, Digital, communication, development teams)
  3. Communication and Coordination 
- Coordinate with all internal departments all deliverables related to Marketing plans (Annual Brand book, Launch book, tailor-made animation guidelines, mock-ups, lab samples etc‚Ä¶) to assure accuracy, homogeneity and deadlines 
- Send Brand communications to markets about Marketing plans, Launch plans updates and retailer‚Äôs presentations 
- Guarantee market alignment and knowledge exchange by proactively contacting local marketing teams and sharing relevant information

 4. Insights and Best Practices
- Produce Launch Reports: consolidating individual reports into a single document 
- Cross-Region fertilization (best practices or special requests) amongst markets 
- Aware of specific needs per region (retailer profile, legal restrictions)   
5. Operations oriented activities 
- CPS analysis: challenge consolidated region figures vs brand expectations. Back & forth with internal teams (marketing development & engineers).
- CPS analysis: referent participant of CPS meeting
- Catalogue maintenance: product line by market and exceptions
- Define Launch guidelines retro-timing, in accordance with CNP: deadlines and responsibilities 
6. Retail Expertise
- Gather retail trends & shopping experience analysis on a regular basis (competition best practices, innovation, art of gifting, animation trends‚Ä¶), to improve brand‚Äôs visibility & shopping experience
- Follow-up of brand‚Äôs distribution & permanent visibility template with key markets informatio

 Experience: 
At least 2-3 years of experience in operational or trade marketing, in international or local positions, ideally acquired in the beauty industry. 
Education:
Master Degree, major in Marketing ideal
 
Languages:
French and English fluent, Spanish would be a plus.
 
 Competencies:
- Strong knowledge of USA/LATAM markets and trends 
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with strong leadership
- Ability to manage operational project keeping a very strategic and logn-term vision
- Result-oriented, self-starter personality with an interest to propose and test new ideas
- Very curious, polyvalent and autonomous
- Strong analytical and project management skills;
- Flexible and reactive, good management of stress
- Olfactive, Fashion and/or Design sensibility

basic_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)

description.text:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams‚Äîincluding Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing‚Äîto rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA‚Äôs strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

description.text:
DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL SALES ‚Äì BASED IN EUROPE
On behalf of our client, Power Technologies, we are seeking a results-driven Director of International Sales to join their team in Europe (remote position). The ideal candidate can speak either German or French (or both), and will have a demonstrated ability to set up distribution, lead channel development initiatives, manage partner relationships, and drive revenue growth through effective sales execution and team collaboration.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Power Technologies designs and markets high-quality products that support the smart charging, network management, and security of mobile digital devices. Mobile devices are continuously evolving and transforming the workflows and operating models of every industry. Our products enable organizations to deploy critical digital tools to their teams with confidence that the devices are ready for use, resulting in increased performance and productivity. At Power Technologies, we bring technology and connection to life. Company website: https://powertechnologies.com/
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer, who is based in the U.S, this role is responsible for managing and expanding our international sales operations across distribution, reseller, and end-user channels within the Education and Commercial sectors (including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare).This position includes direct management of the international sales team, providing leadership, coaching, and performance oversight to ensure alignment with international sales objectives. The Director will coordinate regional sales strategies, monitor team KPIs, and foster a high-performance culture across geographically dispersed markets. In addition, the role will oversee partner enablement, deliver ongoing training, and ensure consistent execution of go-to-market plans.This position has a requirement of having direct experience in the EdTech market, working with distributors and resellers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to international sales team members, setting clear priorities, coaching for performance, and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration in alignment with international sales goals.Translate high-level business strategy into measurable goals and KPIs, ensuring alignment across team members, partners, and internal stakeholders.Develop and execute international sales strategies and tactical plans aligned with annual revenue and profit targets, to expand distribution, reseller, and end-user partnerships, with a strong emphasis on EdTech, ICT, and commercial markets.Manage the international sales and expense budget, tracking performance monthly and adjusting tactics to stay on target.Plan and conduct regular business reviews with distribution partners, ensuring alignment on product updates, brand strategy, marketing activities, and performance metrics.Collaborate with distribution leadership and sales reps to ensure effective lead capture, deal closure, and account management that supports market share growth.Design and implement regional sales and marketing plans, tailored to international markets, to increase visibility and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies‚Äô policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company‚Äôs product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills ‚Äì specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

description.text:
ABOUT BEDROCKBedrock is a media-tech venture, formed as a JV between M6 and RTL Group (part of Bertelsmann). The company is the trusted strategic streaming partner of leading entertainment companies in Europe, operating their full streaming services and delivering state-of-the-art experience to their audiences.With 15+ years of streaming expertise and 450 skilled professionals in 10 countries, Bedrock has become the premier strategic streaming platform in Europe.At Bedrock, we love challenges, whether they're related to features, scaling, performance or peak traffic. We believe that learning new tricks is a journey and sharing them with peers is definitely part of the fun.

Bedrock is looking for a Product Manager with a strong background in Product Management (3+ years) to join our team and contribute to the product strategy, roadmap, and implementation of our platform's advertising monetization capabilities.
You'll be instrumental in the design and delivery of solutions that enable broadcasters and media companies to optimize their advertising revenue and enhance the user ad experience.
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who thrives on turning complex problems into impactful solutions, and who is curious about the Advertising ecosystem (display, video, audio, programmatic, etc.).While prior experience in advertising tech (Ad Servers, SSPs, DSPs‚Ä¶) is a plus what matters is your solid experience in Product Management and your interest in the Ads domain.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
This role offers significant learning opportunities as you help define flexible, scalable solutions supporting diverse ad formats and targeting strategies. You'll operate within a dynamic and evolving ecosystem, ensuring our platform effectively integrates with key third-party advertising systems and addresses our clients' specific business challenges, ultimately reinforcing their trust in our solutions.
As a Product Manager, you will :
Drive Product Strategy: Contribute to the development of our Ads monetization roadmap and help align it with business goals and client needs to maximize advertising revenue.
Build impactful Ad Products: Support the product discovery process and feature delivery within the advertising domain. Contribute to the design and delivery of flexible, configurable tools that allow clients to effectively manage their ad inventories, formats, and targeting strategies.
Assist with Ad Ecosystem & Integration Strategy: Participate in defining and streamlining the platform's integration strategy with Ad Servers, programmatic platforms (SSPs, DSPs), and other ad technologies used by our clients. Help ensure robust connectivity and leverage ecosystem capabilities.
Represent Client & User Needs -Advertising-: Contribute to translating broadcasters' ad monetization strategies into scalable and reliable product features. Help promote solutions that balance platform consistency with necessary customization and configurability. Ensure a high-quality, non-intrusive user ad experience.
Leverage data : Work closely with Data Science/BI teams to define advertising KPIs, analyze platform and client data (e.g., fill rates, click-through rates, RPMs) to derive actionable insights. Participate in defining, prioritizing, and analyzing experiments (A/B tests) to validate hypotheses and optimize ad performance.
Collaborate across teams  Partner with Engineering, UX/UI, Data, Architecture, and Go-To-Market to ensure smooth execution from discovery to deployment. 


WHAT WE‚Äô RE LOOKING FOR
3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally in a B2B SaaS/PaaS environmentStrong ownership mindset, capable of managing products from idea to launch and beyond
Curiosity about Ads monetization models and advertising technology ‚Äî experience in the field is a plus, but not a must
Analytical skills and a data-informed approach to decision-making
Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate with both technical and non-technical teamsand to influence cross-functional teams and build consensus
A proactive, structured, and adaptable working style
Excellent communication and presentation skills : Ability to clearly articulate complex concepts, strategies, and trade-offs to diverse audiences, including executives, technical teams, and clients. 

Beyond technical skills, we are looking for talents with:
Excellent team player who fosters collaborationAbility to adapt to changing environments and challengesStrong focus on client satisfaction and delivering high-quality serviceInnovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvementFluent in English
LIFE AT BEDROCKYou'll join an enthusiastic, friendly and close-knit team in a fast-growing tech company with more than 10 years' experience and a strong network of media shareholders.Work flexibility and brand-new office spaces with a great location.A top-notch tech expertise : documentation, support, R&D, management seniority‚Ä¶Work Evolutions & opportunities within the company, as well as training.Strong human connections knowledge sharing: Last Friday Talks, Demos, Meet-Ups, HR Roadshows

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients‚Äô livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you‚Äôre interested in learning more please apply below!

description.text:
Title: French Speaking Product Marketing Manager ‚Äì Digital Solutions Europe

Location: Remote within EU

Department: Marketing

Reports To: Product Marketing Director (based in Europe)

Functional Group: Digital Solutions

About FoodChain ID

FoodChain ID (www.foodchainid.com) is a global leader in food safety, quality, and sustainability solutions. Our Digital Solutions division helps agribusinesses, manufacturers, and retailers navigate regulatory complexity and unlock value through trusted, data-driven insights.

About The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a strategic and execution-focused Product Marketing Manager to support our Digital Solutions (Agricultural Solutions, Supplements, Packaging) portfolio across Europe, with a particular focus on French-speaking markets. You will drive product positioning, go-to-market strategies, and campaign execution for digital solutions focused on agricultural solutions, packaging and supplements.

This is a remote role within the EU and requires full professional fluency in French.

Key Responsibilities

Market Strategy & PositioningDefine the product positioning and messaging for digital solutions across European markets, with specific focus on French-speaking regionsIdentify local regulatory drivers and competitive dynamics to inform go-to-market approachesGo-to-Market ExecutionPlan and execute launches for new solutions in collaboration with commercial teamLocalize and adapt global messaging to resonate with regional and market-specific needsSales EnablementCreate localized sales tools: pitch decks, one-pagers, value propositions, objection-handling guidesDeliver training and support to regional sales and customer-facing teamsCampaign Support & Demand GenerationSupport campaign execution targeting ag input suppliers, distributors, and cooperatives across EuropeTrack campaign performance and support optimization based on engagement dataVoice of CustomerLead customer interviews and gather market insights to refine personas, positioning, and product roadmap inputsCross-functional CollaborationWork closely with Product, Sales, Regulatory, and the broader Marketing team to align priorities and initiatives
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in marketing, or a related field (Master‚Äôs a plus)5+ years‚Äô experience in B2B product marketing, preferably in agricultural solutions, packaging or supplementsNative or fluent French speaker; professional English requiredProven success in launching products and creating regional market demandExcellent communication skills and project management abilitiesExperience working in a matrixed, global environment

Nice to have

Experience with the following tools: SalesForce, PowerBI, Wordpress, ChatGPT

Performance Indicators

Pipeline generation across European marketsMarketing-sourced lead generation and conversionCampaign ROI and pipeline contributionMQL to Pipeline conversionEffectiveness of localized positioning and messaging

Note: This is a remote role with a preference for candidates based in France or neighboring EU countries. The ability to travel occasionally for team meetings or customer engagements is expected.

Powered by JazzHR

description.text:
Editage, the flagship brand of CACTUS, provides translation services to help ESL (English-as-a-second-language) researchers communicate their science to the global scientific community. We are currently looking for skilled translators to work with us on a freelance basis.

Job description

We are looking for translators to work on non-academic content written in various languages. To qualify, you must have subject expertise in the required field. Experience working in a foreign-language setting will be preferred. Essentially, your work will involve translating content from the original language to native English or vice versa.

Requirements

Applicants must meet any one of the following criteria:

A degree in Translation or an equivalent degree that includes significant translation training, from a recognized institutionA graduate (or higher) degree in any other field from a recognized institution of higher education plus two years of comprehensive professional experience in translationFive years of comprehensive professional experience in translation


Note: If you were associated with us in a similar role in the past, please contact us at freelancetranslator@cactusglobal.com before you apply/register.

description.text:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About The Role üñ•Ô∏è
Based in our Parisian office and reporting to the Director of HRBP Manager, you will join a team of five HR Business Partners, all fully dedicated to developing Vestiaire Collective on a global scale.

As an HRBP, your role will be to:

Collaborate with managers and department heads to align HR initiatives with business objectives

Support managers in managing complex employee relations and resolving conflicts

Develop and implement initiatives aimed at improving employee engagement and talent retention

What You Will Do üëú

Organizational Development Oversee the organizational development of Marketing and Commercial teams Ensure the application of our global HR strategy and policies, while respecting operational requirements Collaborate with other People Partners (Learning & Development, Legal, Talent) to build, continuously improve, and deploy processes related to the employee experience



Be a true partner to your teams

 Drive change management to support employees and managers in implementing new initiatives Support team performance and achievement of objectives by providing HR expertise and ensuring compliance with legal and contractual rules Monitor workplace climate, actively identify early warning signs, and maintain a regular on-site presence Maintain contact and collaborate with occupational health services to ensure individual employee follow-up



Team Development

 Support managers during performance reviews or sensitive situations Help leaders develop and strengthen their skills Conduct annual salary and compensation reviews, ensuring equality and equity Contribute to the annual performance review process, ensuring it remains dynamic and adapted to the company‚Äôs evolution



Who You Are ‚≠ê

Full proficiency in English, French is not required but considered a bonusYou thrive in a dynamic, results-oriented environmentYou genuinely enjoy helping others and have a strong interest in peopleExcellent IT skills, particularly in Excel and HRISSolution-oriented with strong analytical skillsDirect communication and influencing abilitiesFoundational understanding of HR payroll and legal processesSelf-starter with initiative; ideally 3+ years of HR experience to succeed in this role(Bonus) Experience working with marketing and commercial teams



What we offer üéÅ

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package
As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Research indicates that people from underrepresented backgrounds‚Äîincluding women, people with disabilities, and other marginalized communities‚Äîoften hesitate to apply for roles unless they meet every single requirement.

At Vestiaire Collective, we believe that talent comes in many forms, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Your unique perspective could be exactly what our team needs, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't tick every box.

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer 
Beware of Scams
Vestiaire Collective only contacts candidates via official emails ending in @vestiairecollective.com or no-reply@hire.lever.co . We never use WhatsApp, Telegram, or similar apps for job offers, nor will we ever request payments or banking details.

If you receive a suspicious message, please report it to talentacquisition@vestiairecollective.com

Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package
As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Research indicates that people from underrepresented backgrounds‚Äîincluding women, people with disabilities, and other marginalized communities‚Äîoften hesitate to apply for roles unless they meet every single requirement.

At Vestiaire Collective, we believe that talent comes in many forms, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Your unique perspective could be exactly what our team needs, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't tick every box.

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer 
Beware of Scams
Vestiaire Collective only contacts candidates via official emails ending in @vestiairecollective.com or no-reply@hire.lever.co . We never use WhatsApp, Telegram, or similar apps for job offers, nor will we ever request payments or banking details.

If you receive a suspicious message, please report it to talentacquisition@vestiairecollective.com

description.text:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We're looking for a talented and detail-oriented SEO Content Editor to join our growing team of gambling content specialists. You'll play a key role in shaping and optimising content across English-language gambling projects, including but not limited to those covering casinos, sports betting, esports, and crypto betting.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with freelancers and internal teams (including Editors, SEO, Design, Product, and Affiliation) to publish high-quality, SEO-optimized, and user-focused content that aligns with brand and business goals.Edit and optimize content for search intent, readability, and SEO best practices - including title tags, internal linking, metadata, alt text, and imagery.Audit existing content to identify outdated articles, content gaps, and new opportunities to improve authority and rankings.Regularly update and enhance existing articles to maintain accuracy, freshness, and SEO performance.Commission, brief, and manage content creation from both staff and freelance writers using keyword research, search trends, and competitor analysis.Contribute to ongoing content strategy by identifying trending topics and new keyword opportunities to grow organic traffic.Support the Head of Content with content planning, publishing workflows, and managing the editorial calendar to ensure timely delivery.Stay informed on the latest SEO developments, gambling industry news, and content best practices - using insights to enhance the quality and relevance of published content.Collaborate closely with the wider content and SEO team to maintain consistency, voice, and quality across all published material.

Qualifications

Fluent in the English language, with excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation skills.Proven experience as an Editor, Content Manager, or similar role within the iGaming industry - ideally with exposure to esports, casinos, and affiliate content.Good to intermediate understanding of SEO, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and familiarity with tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, or similar.Comfortable using WordPress to upload, edit, and publish content.Solid understanding of online gambling terminology, products, player intent, and current industry trends.Strong attention to detail and a high standard for content accuracy, formatting, and SEO compliance.Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.Effective communication and collaboration skills, working well across teams (e.g., writers, SEO, design, and product).A genuine interest in online gambling, esports, and betting ‚Äî and a desire to stay informed on market developments.Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to contribute ideas and improve workflows and content strategy.Strong problem-solving skills in fast-paced and changing editorial environments.

Preferred Qualifications

Ability to QA and refine AI-generated content while ensuring compliance with quality and tone.Understanding of plagiarism and originality tools (e.g., Copyscape, Grammarly, Originality.ai).Familiarity with crypto betting, blockchain gambling platforms, or Web3 technologies.Working knowledge of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or similar performance tracking tools.Familiarity with brief templates and systems to streamline and standardize large-scale content production.Understanding of odds formats, betting systems, and user personas within betting ecosystems.

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysMarket-leading remunerationAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
Join Our Team as a UX/UI Designer in the thriving iGaming Industry! üöÄ
üß©Who we are? Ludicrum is redefining iGaming, blending creativity with technology to deliver world-class gaming experiences. From marketing and product development to customer support and financial reporting, our teams are changing the game. Our vision is to create ultra-intuitive and engaging platforms to fuel growth through strategic partnerships and market expansion.Our success is driven by core values deeply embedded in our culture. We believe in transparency, always being clear, open, and honest. We are goal-focused, relentlessly pursuing our targets. Adaptability is key‚Äîwe embrace change and use it to excel. Kaizen guides us, as we continuously improve, test, and refine.With a dynamic and collaborative culture and fast career growth, our 250+ global team thrives!
ü•ú In a nutshellWe are seeking a talented UX/UI Designer to join our growing design team. Reporting to the UX/UI Team Lead, you‚Äôll play a key role in crafting intuitive, inclusive, and visually compelling user experiences for our platforms. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with developers and stakeholders across the business to bring ideas to life that truly serve our users.
üéØ The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have:Conduct user research to understand needs, preferences, and behaviorsPerform usability testing and gather feedback for continuous improvementCreate and maintain site maps, user flows, wireframes, and prototypesStructure and organize content to enhance navigation and experienceDesign responsive, visually appealing, and user-friendly interfacesEnsure all designs meet accessibility standards and perform audits as neededCollaborate with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designsStay ahead of industry trends and contribute to evolving design systems
‚ö° All you need is‚Ä¶2+ years of experience as a UX/UI Designer in the iGaming industry, with a portfolio showcasing user research and impactful design solutions.Proficiency in Figma, with the ability to structure content and design intuitive navigation and user flows.Strong visual and interaction design skills, creating elegant, user-friendly, and effective interfaces.Solid knowledge of accessibility standards, ensuring inclusive and compliant design for all users.Proven collaboration with developers and stakeholders, delivering designs in agile, cross-functional teams Nice to haveUnderstanding of HCI principles, applying research-driven methods to guide interface and interaction design.Insight into user psychology, enabling the creation of more intuitive, user-centered experiences.Background in graphic design, adding visual clarity and storytelling to your work.Experience with usability testing, including A/B testing, user journeys, and time-on-task analysis.
üåü Why You‚Äôll love working here:Flexible and Remote Working: Work from anywhere, supporting your work-life balance.Career Growth: We‚Äôre committed to your development, offering training and advancement opportunities.Health and Fitness Benefits: Receive fitness reimbursements from day one, and after one year of employment, gain access to a health budget to support your well-being.Extra Paid Annual Leave: Enjoy 22 days of vacation, with an additional day added for each year of employment, up to a maximum of 26 days.Special Birthday Perk: Take your birthday off after a year of employment to celebrate!
We are not just offering a job; we offer the chance to be part of something bigger. Apply today! Submit your resume in English and join us in creating unforgettable experiences. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

description.text:
Job Highlights:Contract: Independent ContractorSchedule: Between 9:00 am to 4:00 pm, Ambler, PA, USA, Eastern Time
Job Overview:We are looking for a part-time virtual assistant to help modernize and maintain our existing website. This role will initially require monthly updates to keep our site fresh, functional, and aligned with industry trends. After an initial period, the update frequency will shift to a quarterly schedule while still ensuring our website remains visually appealing and optimized for performance.
Responsibilities:Website Modernization: Implement updates to enhance the look, feel, and user experience of our site, including layout improvements, updated visuals, and mobile responsiveness.Content Updates: Modify website content as needed to reflect the latest company offerings, partnerships, and industry trends.SEO Optimization: Perform quarterly SEO audits and updates to improve search rankings and ensure our website remains competitive in organic search results.Performance Monitoring: Identify and resolve technical issues affecting site speed, navigation, and overall functionality.Collaboration: Work closely with our team to ensure updates align with our branding and business objectives.
RequirementsThis is a part-time, remote position, with working hoursProficiency in website design and maintenance (WordPress, HTML, CSS, or relevant CMS platforms).Strong understanding of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Yoast.Experience in UX/UI enhancements to improve visitor engagement.Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.Prior experience in the parking technology or related industries is a plus but not required.
BenefitsIndependent Contractor Perks:Permanent work from homeImmediate hiringSteady freelance job
Please note that since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an ‚ÄúIndependent Contractor‚Äù arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.

basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership ‚Äì Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild‚Äî four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild‚Äôs global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild‚Äôs top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product ‚Äî from market reports to custom research engagements ‚Äî delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild‚Äôs offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic LeadershipDefine and execute Merchant Guild‚Äôs research, analytics, and pricing strategy, ensuring alignment with long-term organizational goals.Collect information from the Retail Consultant to identify market trends, industry shifts, and competitive landscapes.Lead the production of flagship reports, market forecasts, and member intelligence briefings.
Market Insights & AnalyticsDirect the design of market research projects, including quantitative, qualitative, and hybrid methodologies.Oversee predictive analytics, scenario modelling, and competitive benchmarking.Ensure insights are effectively visualized, communicated, and actionable for varied audiences.
Research Quality & IntegrityEstablish and maintain rigorous quality assurance standards for all research outputs.Audit methodologies, validate data sources, and oversee peer review processes.Ensure compliance with ethical research practices and relevant data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Pricing Strategy & Commercial OversightDevelop and maintain a dynamic pricing framework for Merchant Guild‚Äôs research products, memberships, and consulting services.Conduct market-based pricing analysis to ensure competitive positioning while maximizing value and revenue.Collaborate with partnership managers to tailor pricing for custom projects, partnerships, and tiered service offerings.Monitor pricing performance and adjust strategies based on market feedback, demand trends, and profitability targets.
Qualifications8+ years in research operations, data governance, or analytics quality assurance.Strong track record in methodological design, data validation, and compliance.Strong understanding of pricing models, elasticity analysis, and value-based pricing approaches.Expertise in statistical techniques, sampling, and error mitigation.Familiarity with international data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA) and ethical research practices.Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.Proficiency with analytics tools and quality-checking processes.
Performance Metrics & Success Indicators
Research & Insights Delivery98%+ on-time delivery rate for research projects and reports.Zero critical accuracy errors in published research outputs.Stakeholder satisfaction scores of 8/10+ for relevance, clarity, and actionability of insights.
Data Quality & IntegrityAnnual methodology audit pass rate of 100% with no compliance breaches.Reduction in data discrepancies and errors year-over-year.Full compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and internal ethics standards.
Pricing & Revenue ImpactRevenue growth from research services of X% YoY (target set annually).Pricing model adoption rate across at least 90% of product/service lines.

#LI-Remote
