description.text:
The Company
TaskHuman is organizing the world‚Äôs human expertise, making coaching in 1000+ skills instantly accessible to you in a multitude of forms. Whether you connect live with a specialist on a 1:1 video call, message directly in-app, join a group session, or learn via coach-generated content, our value of human connection is the foundation of every interaction at TaskHuman.
The Opportunity
We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on, technically fluent Growth Marketer to drive rapid experimentation and growth loop execution to scale our acquisition and engagement programs. You will be instrumental in executing our growth strategy launching high-impact growth initiatives with speed and autonomy.This is a role for someone who loves to ship, test, and refine. In our B2B2C environment, your user activation and engagement work directly drives client success, making every conversion and retention win doubly important.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and optimize lifecycle-based growth programs across user onboarding, activation, re-engagement, and retention.Launch and scale growth loops and automated campaigns, using event-based triggers and conditional logic.Own the execution and iteration of experiment-driven campaigns, partnering with Product, Analytics and Data Science to rapidly test hypotheses and analyze funnel performance.Partner closely with BI/Analytics team to define success metrics, interpret campaign performance data, and translate insights into actionable optimizations for future campaigns.Operate and manage the marketing tech stack including Iterable, to support fast, self-serve execution across journeys and nudges.Collaborate with engineering and data teams to integrate rich custom event payloads into user workflows, enabling highly personalized, metadata-driven messaging experiences.Maintain execution velocity by owning backlog delivery of growth marketing experiments, ensuring rapid test cycles and continuous campaign optimization.Partner with internal teams including Product, Design, Customer Success, and Coaching Experiences to ensure aligned messaging, go-to-market enablement, and thematic consistency across touchpoints.Guide the structure and QA of AI-generated content for use in dynamic emails and in-product experiences.
Requirements:
3-6+ years experience in growth marketing, lifecycle marketing, or CRM/automation roles, preferably in a startup or fast-paced growth environment.Strong technical fluency with tools and systems like Iterable (or Braze), and event-driven trigger frameworks.Deep experience executing event-based lifecycle automations using custom user properties, branching logic, and dynamic content blocks.Familiarity with working inside JSON-based data structures for dynamic & personalized messaging.Track record of executing growth experiments and interpreting performance through funnel, cohort, and lifecycle metrics.Highly autonomous and self-directed, able to move quickly and make tradeoffs in ambiguous or fast-changing environments.Strong communicator and collaborator across technical and non-technical teams.Experience and appetite for working in a fast-paced technology and innovation environment are highly preferred.Genuine interest in the mission of TaskHuman and being a part of something bigger than any one person or business group.Experience operating in a B2C, B2B2C, or marketplace product environment
TaskHuman provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

basic_info.title: Senior Product Manager - Declarations & Financial Statements Group

description.text:
Are you looking to have an impact on the daily life of millions of entrepreneurs in France (and tomorrow in Europe)?

Are you looking for a work environment that values trust, proactivity, and autonomy?

Are our Product principles aligned with your vision?

Then Pennylane is the right place for you !

 Our vision 

We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of French SMEs and Accounting Firms (and soon, European ones).

We help entrepreneurs rid themselves of time-consuming tasks related to accounting and finance while providing them with access to key financial information to assist in making the best decisions for their business.

About Us

Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!)

In 5 years of existence, we‚Äôve managed to :

üíª Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants

üí∞ Raise a total of ‚Ç¨225 millions, including from Sequoia, the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more...

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Grow from 7 cofounders to 650+ happy Pennylaners : we‚Äôre now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (and also remotely), with a 4.6/5 rating on Glassdoor .

üåç Build an international environment with more than 25 nationalities, with a strong remote-friendly culture, where 30% of the employees are already working from all parts of Europe

ü§ù Earn the trust of thousands of customers and accounting firms and obtain outstanding ratings

üöÄ Already more than 400,000 small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and over 4,500 accounting firms use Pennylane in France!

WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission 

While some companies count on marketing and sales to gain market share, we are a product-led company and are investing primarily in our platform. You‚Äôll join a team with a highly strategic role and a great opportunity to put your skills and ideas to a good use.

HOW you will contribute to the company as a PM 

As a Product Manager, you‚Äôll be part of a 40+ people Product organisation, supported by an engineering team of more than 110 people.

 You‚Äôll spend an extensive amount of time continuously discovering the users and their pain points. You will interview them, conduct user research and get your hands in our data platform to gather insights on what needs to be solved. With those insights and with the company‚Äôs objectives in mind, you‚Äôll be empowered to define your OKRs and your roadmaps, to have the strongest possible impact on solving user problems and reaching the company's objectives. You‚Äôll work hand in hand with a Product Designer dedicated to your squad, as well as a team of Product-centered engineers. You will start with small steps (we like the MVP approach!) and will follow-up on the implementation and future iterations. For us, achieving a common goal matter more than just building features.

Your squad :

As a Product Manager within our Declarations & Financial Statements group, you will help shape one of the most sensitive and strategic parts of the customer journey.

Our mission is to empower accounting firms to manage their clients seamlessly from A to Z, especially during critical moments when legal responsibilities are engaged and financial flows occur.

Your scope will cover the creation of an exhaustive, simple, and automated experience for all types of mandatory declarations, from pre-filling to submission, payment, client notification, and audit-readiness. You‚Äôll also play a key role in delivering high-quality, customizable financial reports (the ‚Äúplaquette‚Äù)‚Äîthe accountant‚Äôs marketing document‚Äîensuring they are both comprehensive and user-friendly.

This is a fast-evolving area with significant opportunities to innovate and build, as many features are still in their infancy.

You‚Äôll be working on highly complex problems and shouldn‚Äôt be afraid to dive deep into the world of accounting. But technical and regulatory mastery is only part of the challenge: you‚Äôll also need a sharp product mindset and a relentless focus on user experience.

Success in this role means not only researching and understanding key accounting rules and formulas, but also transforming this complexity into simple, intuitive, and robust solutions that delight our users. You‚Äôll work closely with designers and engineers to create seamless, automated flows, making even the most intricate declarations accessible and efficient for our customers. If you thrive at the intersection of complexity, design, and impact, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark.

WHAT You Can Expect From Your Life At Pennylane

Within one month

 You‚Äôll learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week You‚Äôll familiarize yourself with the product and the accounting industry (You will have access to a lot of documentation and will assist to trainings organized by your peers) You‚Äôll get a very deep knowledge of our Product organization, methods, and culture

Within 3 months

 You‚Äôll have imagined and implemented your first solutions, hand-in-hand with Product Designers and Engineers You‚Äôll have impacted positively at least one OKR You will have setup your continuous discovery routine and will be ready to build your roadmap

Within 6 months

 You‚Äôll be autonomous at defining your OKRs and your roadmap You‚Äôll keep having a strong impact via iterations on the solutions you've shipped You‚Äôll share your learnings and best practices within the team

And beyond : The product team will double in size in two years.

Which means you‚Äôll have :

 Multiple opportunities to recruit and mentor new PMs Increased responsibilities in project leadership Responsibilities to think of and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even smoother

What do we do to make your work life easier

üè¢ You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to

üìà You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

üè° You‚Äôll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

‚õπÔ∏èThrough our partner Gymlib, you‚Äôll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

üá¨üáß You‚Äôll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

üíª You‚Äôll get the latest Apple equipment

üéâ You‚Äôll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

üè¢ You‚Äôll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

üèùYou‚Äôll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

üçú You‚Äôll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

üè• You‚Äôll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries. 

What does the recruitment process look like ? 

 You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager (30 min) You‚Äôll then have a discussion with 1 member of our Product team to assess the fit and the Product culture (45 min) You‚Äôll then pass a live case study with 2 PMs from our team (1h15) You'll have a final round with Tancr√®de (our CPO) and a Group PM or a Head of Product (60 mn)

We make sure we move fast ; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total. 

Who are we looking for ?

 Strong user research skills and Product sense: ability to develop a strong conviction about user needs and problems based on user feedback (from all types of sources) Strong & structured communication skills to convince and get buy in on his/her vision, embark/drive the squad, build relationships with commercial teams, talk to users regularly.. Ability to navigate and simplify complex problems (understand, vulgarize, break problems into small pieces) Hands-on and not afraid to step out of the traditional product role to make the product succeed (working on Educational content, and enablement if needed..) Past experience in Product management at a scale up or large tech company is required (ideally a company with a strong product culture) Experience working with accounting is not required (generalist profile is ok) as long as they are curious about accounting and comfortable with complexity.

You will interview them, conduct user research and get your hands in our data platform to gather insights on what needs to be solved. With those insights and with the company‚Äôs objectives in mind, you‚Äôll be empowered to define your OKRs and your roadmaps, to have the strongest possible impact on solving user problems and reaching the company's objectives. You‚Äôll work hand in hand with a Product Designer dedicated to your squad, as well as a team of Product-centered engineers. You will start with small steps (we like the MVP approach!) and will follow-up on the implementation and future iterations. For us, achieving a common goal matter more than just building features.

Your squad :

As a Product Manager within our Declarations & Financial Statements group, you will help shape one of the most sensitive and strategic parts of the customer journey.

Our mission is to empower accounting firms to manage their clients seamlessly from A to Z, especially during critical moments when legal responsibilities are engaged and financial flows occur.

Your scope will cover the creation of an exhaustive, simple, and automated experience for all types of mandatory declarations, from pre-filling to submission, payment, client notification, and audit-readiness. You‚Äôll also play a key role in delivering high-quality, customizable financial reports (the ‚Äúplaquette‚Äù)‚Äîthe accountant‚Äôs marketing document‚Äîensuring they are both comprehensive and user-friendly.

This is a fast-evolving area with significant opportunities to innovate and build, as many features are still in their infancy.

You‚Äôll be working on highly complex problems and shouldn‚Äôt be afraid to dive deep into the world of accounting. But technical and regulatory mastery is only part of the challenge: you‚Äôll also need a sharp product mindset and a relentless focus on user experience.

Success in this role means not only researching and understanding key accounting rules and formulas, but also transforming this complexity into simple, intuitive, and robust solutions that delight our users. You‚Äôll work closely with designers and engineers to create seamless, automated flows, making even the most intricate declarations accessible and efficient for our customers. If you thrive at the intersection of complexity, design, and impact, this is the perfect opportunity to make your mark.

WHAT You Can Expect From Your Life At Pennylane

Within one month

 You‚Äôll learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week You‚Äôll familiarize yourself with the product and the accounting industry (You will have access to a lot of documentation and will assist to trainings organized by your peers) You‚Äôll get a very deep knowledge of our Product organization, methods, and culture

Within 3 months

 You‚Äôll have imagined and implemented your first solutions, hand-in-hand with Product Designers and Engineers You‚Äôll have impacted positively at least one OKR You will have setup your continuous discovery routine and will be ready to build your roadmap

Within 6 months

 You‚Äôll be autonomous at defining your OKRs and your roadmap You‚Äôll keep having a strong impact via iterations on the solutions you've shipped You‚Äôll share your learnings and best practices within the team

And beyond : The product team will double in size in two years.

Which means you‚Äôll have :

 Multiple opportunities to recruit and mentor new PMs Increased responsibilities in project leadership Responsibilities to think of and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even smoother

What do we do to make your work life easier

üè¢ You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to

üìà You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

üè° You‚Äôll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

‚õπÔ∏èThrough our partner Gymlib, you‚Äôll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

üá¨üáß You‚Äôll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

üíª You‚Äôll get the latest Apple equipment

üéâ You‚Äôll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

üè¢ You‚Äôll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

üèùYou‚Äôll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

üçú You‚Äôll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

üè• You‚Äôll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries. 

What does the recruitment process look like ? 

 You will first have a general chat with a Talent Acquisition Manager (30 min) You‚Äôll then have a discussion with 1 member of our Product team to assess the fit and the Product culture (45 min) You‚Äôll then pass a live case study with 2 PMs from our team (1h15) You'll have a final round with Tancr√®de (our CPO) and a Group PM or a Head of Product (60 mn)

We make sure we move fast ; you can expect the recruitment process with us to last between 15 and 25 days in total. 

Who are we looking for ?

 Strong user research skills and Product sense: ability to develop a strong conviction about user needs and problems based on user feedback (from all types of sources) Strong & structured communication skills to convince and get buy in on his/her vision, embark/drive the squad, build relationships with commercial teams, talk to users regularly.. Ability to navigate and simplify complex problems (understand, vulgarize, break problems into small pieces) Hands-on and not afraid to step out of the traditional product role to make the product succeed (working on Educational content, and enablement if needed..) Past experience in Product management at a scale up or large tech company is required (ideally a company with a strong product culture) Experience working with accounting is not required (generalist profile is ok) as long as they are curious about accounting and comfortable with complexity.

description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

ü§© Why is your role important?

As Qovery‚Äôs first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You‚Äôll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

üöÄ What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you‚Äôll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery‚Äôs value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery‚Äôs Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you‚Äôll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

üí° About you

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here‚Äôs What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS ‚Äî ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder‚Äôs mindset ‚Äî you‚Äôve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you‚Äôre eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills ‚Äî you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious ‚Äî you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature ‚Äî you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive ‚Äî in a small team, you‚Äôre comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

üéØ What You‚Äôll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

üí• Our Talent Acquisition Process

We‚Äôve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery‚Äôs values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We‚Äôre committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text:
At Accelerant, we‚Äôre transforming the way capacity is distributed to specialist MGAs across Europe, UK, US and Canada. We help our partner MGA‚Äôs growth through high-quality capacity, strategic advice, streamlined processes, and exceptional service. We value innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach to create lasting success for our partners.
The RoleTo be successful in this role you will need significant experience of insurance and MGA operations/binder management. You also need to be a comfortable leader.
We are seeking a French-speaking Insurance Professional to join our growing team of experts. The Member Relationship Director lead MGA onboarding, relationship management, and operational delivery for our MGA Members across Europe. This is a high-impact role where you will be the key link between our Members, Brokers, Underwriters, and internal teams ‚Äî ensuring exceptional service and strategic growth opportunities.
What You'll DoLead onboarding for new MGA Members, from due diligence to operational go-live.Manage relationships with existing MGA Members, ensuring ongoing satisfaction and growth.Identify strategic and tactical opportunities to support MGA Member success.Oversee and improve operational processes for greater efficiency.Ensure compliance with local and European regulatory standards.Act as an escalation point for operational issues, audits, and credit control matters.Coordinate with TPAs, Brokers, and Underwriters for smooth and timely information flow.
What You BringStrong knowledge and understanding of MGA operations and binder management.Experience in insuranceFluency in French and English (additional European languages are a plus).Proven experience managing MGA or delegated authority business relationships.Strong understanding of European insurance market regulations.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.Self-starter mindset with the ability to work in a geographically diverse team.
Why Join UsBe part of a fast-growing, innovative company redefining delegated underwriting.Work alongside industry experts in an international, collaborative environment.Opportunity to shape and improve processes with measurable impact.Competitive compensation.
Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:
Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That‚Äôs why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.
Health and wellness: We offer high-quality health, dental, and other benefits to ensureour team members have access to the care they need.
Remote work: Work where you‚Äôre most productive and fulfilled. This position is open to remote candidates across Europe who have the flexibility to work with our teams distributed across Europe and North America. Most cross-team collaboration happens in the mornings of the Eastern Time Zone.
Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.

About Accelerant:Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged ‚Äì so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai
Ready to join us? Apply now and help us deliver exceptional service to our MGA Members across Europe.

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Publishing team plays a strategic role in the company‚Äôs growth and serves as a launchpad for Voodoo‚Äôs future leaders. The team brings together top performers from consulting, finance, and tech with a passion for product, creativity, and execution.

As part of Voodoo Gaming, we partner with studios to build games from initial concept to global launch, aiming to create the next wave of iconic, chart-topping hybrid-casual hits. With over eight billion downloads and counting, Voodoo is the world‚Äôs largest and most successful hybrid-casual publisher.

Role

Building and nurturing Voodoo‚Äôs presence in France by developing strong relationships across the local gaming ecosystem(s)Building and managing a portfolio of high-potential studios through outreach, industry events, and partnershipsGuiding studios on product strategy and creative direction to build strong, marketable prototypesLeading launches as a product director by forming the product vision, roadmap, and execution to scale successful titlesOwning the full P&L of your games, with a sharp focus on growth and profitabilityDriving deep market and competitive analysis to identify trends and define what we should build next

Profile

Master‚Äôs degree from a top-tier business or engineering school3+ years in a fast-paced, analytical environment (e.g. consulting, banking, tech, or startups)Strong strategic thinking, product sense, and analytical skillsPassionate about gaming and consumer productsComfortable owning complex projects and working autonomouslyExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsFluent in English and FrenchPersonal passion or creative interest outside of work

Benefits

Competitive salaryPremium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by VoodooSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)Wellness activities in our Paris officeRemote daysChild daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

description.text:
Budget: 700

About Us

Marble is a fintech infrastructure startup, backed by VCs and Hexa.

We build a groundbreaking open-source decision engine for banks, payment service providers and marketplaces.

The Opportunity: Your Mission

As our first dedicated Product Designer, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the user experience of a powerful, data-rich platform from the ground up. Your mission is to translate the complexity of fraud detection and investigation into a simple, intuitive, and powerful interface for our users. You'll work directly with the founders to set the design vision and create a product that not only looks good but empowers financial institutions to make critical decisions with confidence.

What You'll Do

Own the end-to-end design process, from wireframes and user flows to high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.Design intuitive dashboards, complex data visualizations, and streamlined workflows for new and existing features (approx. 2/3 of your time).Elevate and unify our existing product experience, focusing on improving navigation, usability, and overall UX.Build, maintain, and extend our Design System in Figma to ensure consistency and accelerate development.Collaborate closely with the CEO, CTO, and two front-end developers in a tight feedback loop, balancing user needs, technical constraints, and business goals.

Who We're Looking For: Skills & Experience

A Proven B2B/SaaS Designer: You have a strong portfolio with a proven track record of designing complex, user-facing web applications. Experience with enterprise software, analytics dashboards, or the fintech/banking sector is a significant plus.A UX Strategist: You excel at making the complex simple. You design interfaces that don't just look good but feel intuitive, and you obsess over edge cases to create a robust user experience.A Figma Pro: You are highly proficient with modern Figma practices, including auto-layout, variants, and creating scalable Design Systems.A Pragmatic Collaborator: You thrive working hand-in-hand with developers. You know how to communicate design decisions clearly, give and receive constructive feedback, and find pragmatic solutions.Detail-Oriented: You can design for a range of screen sizes (desktop-focused) and are mindful of challenges like internationalization.Team Player: You're willing to occasionally assist with visual assets for our website or blog to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.

How We Work At Marble

We are a small, lean team of seasoned industry experts with the ambition to remake anti-fraud from the bottom up.We plan for the long game but focus on fast value. We choose the simplest solution and iterate quickly. We compromise on feature breadth rather than security or usability.We are opinionated, but set our ego aside. We discuss, commit, execute.We are pragmatic and we execute fast on our decisions. We are perseverant when facing challenges but review plans if we hit a roadblock.We excel at our job but work beyond our field of expertise. No task is below us.We always take ownership - but also know when to share it.We value output over input. We allow for flexibility and optimize for focus time.

The Details

Engagement: Part-time freelance contract, starting at 2 days/week.Duration: 6+ months, with the potential to increase to 3+ days/week as we grow.Location: Remote, within a UTC+0 to UTC+4 time zone (approx. +-2 hours from Paris).Compensation: We offer a competitive freelance rate based on your experience. Let us know your expectations.

Organization

We are looking for a part-time position, 2 days a week, for 6 months+.Depending on team growth, we may need to increase to 3 days+/week in the medium term.We are ok for remote work for this part-time position, at +- 2 hours of Paris time.Compensation based on experience and region

Hiring Process

Portfolio Review: We'll review your application and portfolio.Introductory Chat (30 min): A call with our CTO to discuss your experience, our mission, and the role.Paid & Practical Work Assignment (~3 hours): A small, well-defined design task that reflects our daily challenges. We respect your time and expertise, so this assignment is compensated.Final Discussion & Offer.

The Opportunity: Your Mission

As our first dedicated Product Designer, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the user experience of a powerful, data-rich platform from the ground up. Your mission is to translate the complexity of fraud detection and investigation into a simple, intuitive, and powerful interface for our users. You'll work directly with the founders to set the design vision and create a product that not only looks good but empowers financial institutions to make critical decisions with confidence.

What You'll Do

Own the end-to-end design process, from wireframes and user flows to high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.Design intuitive dashboards, complex data visualizations, and streamlined workflows for new and existing features (approx. 2/3 of your time).Elevate and unify our existing product experience, focusing on improving navigation, usability, and overall UX.Build, maintain, and extend our Design System in Figma to ensure consistency and accelerate development.Collaborate closely with the CEO, CTO, and two front-end developers in a tight feedback loop, balancing user needs, technical constraints, and business goals.

Who We're Looking For: Skills & Experience

A Proven B2B/SaaS Designer: You have a strong portfolio with a proven track record of designing complex, user-facing web applications. Experience with enterprise software, analytics dashboards, or the fintech/banking sector is a significant plus.A UX Strategist: You excel at making the complex simple. You design interfaces that don't just look good but feel intuitive, and you obsess over edge cases to create a robust user experience.A Figma Pro: You are highly proficient with modern Figma practices, including auto-layout, variants, and creating scalable Design Systems.A Pragmatic Collaborator: You thrive working hand-in-hand with developers. You know how to communicate design decisions clearly, give and receive constructive feedback, and find pragmatic solutions.Detail-Oriented: You can design for a range of screen sizes (desktop-focused) and are mindful of challenges like internationalization.Team Player: You're willing to occasionally assist with visual assets for our website or blog to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.

How We Work At Marble

We are a small, lean team of seasoned industry experts with the ambition to remake anti-fraud from the bottom up.We plan for the long game but focus on fast value. We choose the simplest solution and iterate quickly. We compromise on feature breadth rather than security or usability.We are opinionated, but set our ego aside. We discuss, commit, execute.We are pragmatic and we execute fast on our decisions. We are perseverant when facing challenges but review plans if we hit a roadblock.We excel at our job but work beyond our field of expertise. No task is below us.We always take ownership - but also know when to share it.We value output over input. We allow for flexibility and optimize for focus time.

The Details

Engagement: Part-time freelance contract, starting at 2 days/week.Duration: 6+ months, with the potential to increase to 3+ days/week as we grow.Location: Remote, within a UTC+0 to UTC+4 time zone (approx. +-2 hours from Paris).Compensation: We offer a competitive freelance rate based on your experience. Let us know your expectations.

Organization

We are looking for a part-time position, 2 days a week, for 6 months+.Depending on team growth, we may need to increase to 3 days+/week in the medium term.We are ok for remote work for this part-time position, at +- 2 hours of Paris time.Compensation based on experience and region

Hiring Process

Portfolio Review: We'll review your application and portfolio.Introductory Chat (30 min): A call with our CTO to discuss your experience, our mission, and the role.Paid & Practical Work Assignment (~3 hours): A small, well-defined design task that reflects our daily challenges. We respect your time and expertise, so this assignment is compensated.Final Discussion & Offer.

description.text:
We‚Äôre looking for a Casino Manager for a fast-growing iGaming business. 
You'll be at the heart of the product, evaluating new game titles, curating the best mix for players, and constantly refining the content strategy through data and player behavior. Whether it‚Äôs reviewing game mechanics, analyzing hit rates, or testing themes, you‚Äôll help define what great looks like in the casino lobby.
This is a role for someone who lives and breathes casino content ‚Äî someone who wants to build structured, scalable processes while staying close to the games that make players come back.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing:
Reviewing upcoming games and assessing their potential fit for our playersUsing data to spot trends, player favorites, and untapped opportunitiesCreating repeatable systems for content launches, tagging, and localizationWorking with Product to ensure content and features go hand in handBuilding relationships with providers to secure standout titles and exclusives

description.text:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations‚Äô biggest challenge ‚Äì navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What you bring

A solid understanding of payment networks, the mechanics behind payments settlement andExperience working within the bounds of regulatory and compliance requirementsExperience integrating third party payment service providersDemonstrated ability to operate effectively in intense startup or scale-up environments, navigating ambiguity and driving clear outcomesStrong track record of influencing and improving company-wide business metrics through strategic product decisions.A flair for user experience design - you build things beautifully, and they delight customersExecution-oriented, ambitious, and ready to scale your career with RemoteA high agency, low ego mindsetWrites and speaks fluent EnglishIt's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize global payroll payments solutionsCollaborate with Design and Engineering to create intuitive and user-friendly payment flowsWork with product teams across Remote to ensure salary payments happen on time, every timeEnsure seamless integration with third-party payment providers.Partner with compliance and legal teams to ensure all payment features meet regulatory requirementsFunction effectively across teams, working closely with stakeholders in Operations, Risk, Tax, Legal


Practicals

You'll report to: Group Product ManagerTeam: Payments - Payroll PaymentsTeam size:Location: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify: EMEA, APACStart date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $45,750 - $128,650. USD. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser InterviewPrior employment verification check 


Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$45,750‚Äî$128,650 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You‚Äôll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don‚Äôt have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it‚Äôs important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

description.text:
With over 30,000 customers, including a third of Fortune 500 companies, Tempo is trusted by organizations across the globe to make their workflows work better.

We create a suite of integrated solutions for time management, resource planning, budget management, roadmapping, program management, reporting and more. We create the tech that enables the modern team to deliver ‚Äì for every step from first vision to value.

Since our beginning in 2007 as a project to make a time-tracking tool to help a client ‚Äì Tempo has expanded to become the #1 time management add-on for Jira, and we have developed and acquired a multitude of tools to become one of the most trusted names in the Atlassian ecosystem.

We want everyone to work better ‚Äì but we also want to be a tech company with a heart. Join us as we continuously innovate our award-winning products, create new solutions, and help the world work smarter, not harder.

About The Role

As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Tempo, you‚Äôll be a strategic partner to our largest customers, helping them drive value from our SaaS products that work together as part of an integrated suite of solutions.

In this role, you‚Äôll own direct customer relationships, leading them through adoption and renewal. You‚Äôll work closely with leaders on strategic planning, prioritization, and execution alignment‚Äîwhile also engaging users to ensure effective usage and measurable outcomes. You'll be accountable for commercial performance, including Gross Revenue Retention (GRR) and Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and play a key role in identifying success stories and expansion opportunities.

This is a high-impact role for someone who can move comfortably between executive-level discussions and product-focused adoption work, thrives in fast-changing environments, and has a strong sense of ownership and urgency.

What You‚Äôll Do

Own the post-sale customer lifecycle across a portfolio of enterprise accounts.Lead strategic conversations with stakeholders around planning, prioritization, and value realization using Tempo‚Äôs integrated suite of SaaS products aligned to customer success criteria.Drive GRR and NRR by managing renewals, surfacing expansion opportunities, and proactively mitigating risks.Facilitate regular business reviews and outcome-focused success planning sessions directly with customer champions and decision makers .Work closely with operational users‚Äîsuch as project and program managers, Jira admins, and agile team leads‚Äîto guide adoption and remove friction points in the user base.Deliver best practices aligned to personas, industry and desired future states in portfolio, project and resource management workflows.Accurately forecast renewals and lead commercial discussions in partnership with Sales.Document customer goals, usage trends, risks, and outcomes with discipline and clarity on a continuous basis.Collaborate with Product and Sales to ensure a seamless and unified customer experience.Identify and help craft customer stories and case studies with the goal of highlighting their successes and raising awareness of our solutions.

Who You Are

5+ years SaaS Customer Success or Account Manager with experience managing enterprise customers and owning commercial outcomes.Strong communicator with the ability to persistently and continuously engage both senior business leaders and technical or operational users.Comfortable leading success planning, executive reviews, and renewal negotiations.Knowledge of key personas such as Project/Product/Program Managers, Agile Coaches, Jira Admins, and PMO leaders.Highly organized, proactive, and motivated by customer outcomes and long-term value creation.Embraces change and thrives in a fast-scaling, cross-functional environment.

Why Join Tempo?

Impact: Work on meaningful products that empower enterprise users and improve productivity.Innovation: Be part of a culture that values creativity and innovation, with opportunities to make a real impact.Collaboration: Join a supportive, collaborative UX team that values openness, communication, and a continuous learning environment.Growth: Opportunities for professional development, including conferences, courses, and mentorship.

What's In It For You (Org-wide) -

Remote First work environmentUnlimited vacation in most of our locations!!Great benefits including health, dental, vision and savings plan.Perks such as training reimbursement, WFH reimbursement, and more.Diverse and dynamic teams with challenging and exciting work.An opportunity to have a real impact on our business.A great range of social activities (both in person and virtual).Optional in person meet-ups and the ability to travel to our international officesEmployee referral programAnd so much more!

Note: As our hiring teams are global, please submit your resume in English only

Apply today to join the Tempo team and help shape the future of enterprise productivity software.

Join us at Tempo Software, where we proudly foster an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

description.text:
Role DescriptionThis is a full-time remote role for a Technical Product Manager. The Technical Product Manager will be responsible for managing the product lifecycle, developing product strategies, gathering and prioritizing product requirements, and working closely with engineering, sales, marketing, and support teams. products meet company goals and customer needs.
Responsibilities ‚ú® Drive product vision, strategy & roadmap ‚ú® Define and manage product requirements across the lifecycle ‚ú® Collaborate with engineering teams to deliver world-class solutions ‚ú® Engage with clients (wallets, exchanges, asset managers) to gather feedback and improve onboarding ‚ú® Track performance metrics & optimize product features ‚ú® Stay ahead of crypto trends to shape future innovations
Qualifications
 üîπ 2+ years in product management (not project/PO) üîπ Experience or strong passion for the crypto industry (DeFi, validators, staking, etc.) üîπ Technical background (backend, APIs) & ability to collaborate with engineers üîπ Strong communication & analytical skills üîπ Product-driven mindset with empathy for B2B & retail users üîπ Thrives in fast-paced startup/scaleup environments

description.text:
üíª Job Title: AI Leadü§ë Salary: up to ~‚Ç¨200k (flex for the right candidate)üìà Equity: up to 0.5% (valued at $625k)üìç Location: fully remote anywhere in Europe (quarterly team get togethers)üîê Company: Cyber Security SaaS start-up building AI agents to identify and resolve cloud vulnerabilitiesüë• Team: ~20 (aiming for 35+ by year end)üí∏ Funding: $30m+ Series A
Are you looking for the next big thing and want to work on novel products? üöÄ
üëâ If you‚Äôve led AI research, built prototypes that turned into products and want to architect the future of intelligent security, this could be your defining role at a well-funded start-up, operating at the intersection of AI and cybersecurity.
We‚Äôre searching for an AI leader to set the vision, shape the research agenda and turn cutting-edge ideas into real-world impact. Working closely with the CTO, you'll own the end-to-end AI strategy, drive innovation with LLMs and agent systems, guide a growing team of top talent and translate research into breakthrough product capabilities that protect organisations worldwide.
This role is for someone who thrives at combining deep technical expertise with strategic leadership, and is eager to define the standards of how AI transforms security.
ü´µ What you'll do:Define the AI vision: Develop and own the long-term strategy for applying machine learning and generative models to solve complex security problems.Turn research into products: Build prototypes of new techniques, validate them and work with engineering to transform them into customer-facing features.Establish evaluation standards: Design systems and benchmarks that measure the performance of LLMs, agents and AI-driven workflows in real-world security contexts.Raise the technical bar: Provide architectural guidance, review implementations, and ensure quality across all AI-related initiatives.Build and grow the team: Hire, mentor and lead AI talent, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
‚úÖ Must have requirements:Deep LLM, NLP, GenAI and Agentic AI expertise - you must have hands-on experience with modern transformer architectures, autonomous agent systems, fine-tuning techniques, evaluations and agent frameworksA track record of guiding teams and shaping AI direction at leading research labs, major tech companies or fast-moving startups (think DeepMind, OpenAI, Anthropic, Microsoft, Google or similar)Ability to move quickly from research phase to working prototypes to scalable production systems.Experience applying AI research to practical business challenges and measuring success through user and market impact.Strong engineering foundation with a software development background (ideally in Python) and the ability to design, review and critique complex architectures.Security consciousness - understanding of vulnerability management
üëç Bonus points for:Cybersecurity domain knowledge or experience applying AI to security challengesAdvanced academic credentials (PhD or equivalent) with publications in respected conferences/journals.Familiarity with AI safety, benchmarking, and responsible deployment practices.
